Class Sorts

  • java.lang.Object
    • Sorts

  • public class Sorts
extends java.lang.Object

    • Method Detail

      • getStepCount

        public long getStepCount()
        Gets the amount of steps an algorithm takes to sort
        Returns:
        The amount of steps an algorithm takes to sort.

      • setStepCount

        public void setStepCount(int stepCount)
        Sets the amount of steps it takes to sort a list
        Parameters:
        stepCount - The amount of steps it takes.

      • bubbleSort

        public void bubbleSort(int[] list)
        This method will sort a list using bubble sort. Larger numbers will be pushed to the top of the list until the list is sorted.
        Parameters:
        list - A list of integers to be sorted.

      • insertionSort

        public void insertionSort(int[] list)
        This method will sort a list using insertion sort. Smaller numbers are removed from the list, and the list is shifted over until it is not smaller than the left number. It "inserts" it into the right spot.
        Parameters:
        list -

      • mergeSort

        public void mergeSort(int[] a,
             int first,
             int last)
        This method will recursively sort a list using merge sort. The list is broken down into smaller sub-sections and then sorted with respect to the smaller list. The smaller lists are then merged back together.
        Parameters:
        a - The list of integers.
        first - The first index of the array.
        last - The last index of the array.

      • quickSort

        public void quickSort(int[] a,
             int first,
             int last)
        This method will recursively sort an array using quick sort. A pivot point will be selected and numbers of the left and right bound will be compared to each other until they can be swapped with each other.
        Parameters:
        a - The array of integers.
        first - The first index of the array.
        last - The last index of the array.

      • selectionSort

        public void selectionSort(int[] list)
        This method will sort an array using selection sort. The list is divided into two parts and will pick the smallest value to place into the first part of the list.
        Parameters:
        list - The array of integers.

      • fillArray

        public int[] fillArray()
        Fills the array to be used in sorting.
        Returns:
        A randomly filled array of integers.

      • screenOutput

        public void screenOutput(int[] temp)
        prints out the contents of the array in tabular form, 20 columns
